nodeChoice.text: Forward!

outcome.outcomeText: Outcome text

nodeChoice.text: Sacrifice some of your food for Zeus.

outcome.outcomeText: Zeus is pleased. The crew enjoy a hearty meal.

nodeChoice.text: Sacrifice some of your food for Athena.

outcome.outcomeText: Athena is pleased. The crew enjoy a hearty meal.

nodeChoice.text: Sacrifice some of your food for Artemis.

outcome.outcomeText: Artemis is pleased. The crew enjoy a hearty meal.

nodeChoice.text: Sacrifice some of your food for Hermes.

outcome.outcomeText: Hermes is pleased. The crew enjoy a hearty meal.

nodeChoice.text: Sacrifice some of your food for Aphrodite.

outcome.outcomeText: Aphrodite is pleased. The crew enjoy a hearty meal.

storyNode.teaserText: Idas challenges Jason to a wrestling contest

nodeChoice.text: They wrestle, Jason pinning Idas and winning easily.

outcome.outcomeText: The crew is entertained and Jason feels strong.

storyNode.teaserText: Idas challenges Hercules to an archery contest.

nodeChoice.text: They arch, Hercules out-shooting Idas with ease.

outcome.outcomeText: The crew is entertained, and Hercules is happy.

storyNode.teaserText: Idas challenges Jason to a hunting contest

nodeChoice.text: They hunt, Atalanta bringing back a buck and trumping Idas's turtle.

outcome.outcomeText: The crew is entertained and Atalanta feels cocky.

storyNode.teaserText: Idas challenges Orpheus to a singing contest.

nodeChoice.text: They sing and play music. Orpheus's voice is like the song of birds. Idas sounds like a drowning goose.

outcome.outcomeText: The crew is entertained, although their ears sting. Orpheus is happy that the crew is happy.

storyNode.teaserText: The crew is arguing. They come to Jason for a solution

nodeChoice.text: Jason decides to blow them off and instead asks Hercules to take care of it. Hercules then reduces his rage by shouting threats at them

outcome.outcomeText: The crew is cowed and even more displeased.

nodeChoice.text: Jason deals with the problem.

outcome.outcomeText: The crew manages to sort itself out, but it wears on Jason.

storyNode.teaserText: The Argonauts question Jason about Hercules.

nodeChoice.text: Tell the crew what happened.

outcome.outcomeText: Jason tells the crew what transpired. Even though Zeus guided them, they are still unhappy.

nodeChoice.text: As the crew console Hercules over Hylas, the boat is assaulted by rain.

outcome.outcomeText: As the crew console Hercules over Hylas, the boat is assaulted by rain.

storyNode.teaserText: The crew accuses Jason of being pathetic and leaving Hercules behind.

nodeChoice.text: Jason lashes out, and he and the crew have a falling out.
Stress that it's Zeus's will.
Cave and apologise, accepting blame.

storyNode.teaserText: A member of the crew is sabotaging Jason.

nodeChoice.text: Throw him overboard.

outcome.outcomeText: The crew member is left to the sharks

nodeChoice.text: Kill him to make a point.

outcome.outcomeText: He is killed on the spot

nodeChoice.text: Drop him off at the next island, straight into prison.

outcome.outcomeText: You continue sailing, keeping a watch on the traitor, and let him off at the next inhabited island.

nodeChoice.text: He tells Orpheus about the island he should visit.

outcome.outcomeText: Orpheus is now armed with knowledge.

storyNode.teaserText: Jason offers to let Hercules go.

nodeChoice.text: Hercules accepts and will get off at the next kurnel.
Hercules Says no.
Goes to Orpheus for help.
Melon goes to cry.

storyNode.teaserText: Visit the Island of the Goddess

nodeChoice.text: Jason partakes in the ritual

outcome.outcomeText: Jason is blessed by the goddess

nodeChoice.text: Jason chickens out and leaves

outcome.outcomeText: Jason is rebuked by his shipmates

storyNode.teaserText: The Argonauts must pass the city of Troy

nodeChoice.text: Sail through smartly under the cover of night.

outcome.outcomeText: You sail through successfully.

nodeChoice.text: Taunt the Trojans and sail through in broad daylight.

outcome.outcomeText: You now have to deal with the Trojans, and they aren't happy.

nodeChoice.text: Try and negotiate passage through the Trojan waters.

outcome.outcomeText: The negotiations are tense but successful.

nodeChoice.text: Partake the in the feast and merriment with abandon.

outcome.outcomeText: The heroes enjoy an afternoon of drinking and eating. However, news of your plan reaches Cizicus's ears, and he refuses to help you more due to Your quest to steal from an ally of his.

nodeChoice.text: Partake the in the feast and merriment with restraint.

outcome.outcomeText: The heroes enjoy an afternoon of eating and drinking. Cizicus does not learn of your plan and offers to resupply your food and water, which you accept.

nodeChoice.text: Do not partake the in the feast and merriment.

outcome.outcomeText: You wish the king well but continue on your path.

nodeChoice.text: Attack! Slaughter them all!.

outcome.outcomeText: You kill all the inhabitants of the palace, leaving a bloodbath and corpses in your wake.

nodeChoice.text: Ignore her as well to show your appreciation for your host.

outcome.outcomeText: The heroes enjoy a pleasant sacrifice. However, Athena is furious. Orpheus is fearful.

nodeChoice.text: Send a dispatch of men to make a sacrifice to her in secret.

outcome.outcomeText: Athena appreciates your efforts to include her. Orpheus is pleased

nodeChoice.text: Do not join the sacrifice unless Cizicus allows you to sacrifice to the goddess.

outcome.outcomeText: You are thrown out of your butt.

nodeChoice.text: Have Cizicus replace him as he offered and take Tiphys to a sick bed.

outcome.outcomeText: The crew has mixed reaction to the new team-mate, and wish Tiphys swift recovery.

nodeChoice.text: Have Cizicus replace him as he offered and take Tiphys to a sick bed.

outcome.outcomeText: The crew has mixed reaction to the new team-mate, and wish Tiphys swift recovery.

storyNode.teaserText: Hylas runs away from the team
storyNode.eventText: Hylas escapes, prompting a rage to overcome Hercules, who tries to follow him.

nodeChoice.text: Leave without Hercules, as Zeus wishes.

outcome.outcomeText: Hercules is gone for good, and the crew is very sad. Zeus is pleased.

nodeChoice.text: Wait for Hercules and disobey Zeus.

outcome.outcomeText: Zeus is furious. The crew on the other hand is elated.

storyNode.teaserText: Hercules is furious that Hylas left.

nodeChoice.text: Hercules destroys half the forest.

outcome.outcomeText: Hercules can't control himself and tears down half the forest in anger.

nodeChoice.text: Go to Appolo's Island.
Maybe later.

storyNode.teaserText: Atalanta has to make a decision.

nodeChoice.text: Stay faithful to Artemis.
Ignore the goddess will and fall in love.
Artemis gets even with Atalanta.

storyNode.teaserText: Atalanta has to make a decision.

nodeChoice.text: Stay faithful to Artemis.
Fight off the villagers and take their food.
In addition, rape the women and plunder the village.
Creep in with Atalanta and take some food and water.
Approach with Orpheus and offer treasure for supplies.

storyNode.teaserText: Have a contest to see who can bring back the largest prey.

nodeChoice.text: Atalanta wins.
Destroy the village and all who inhabit it.
Spare them, but accept their tribute.
Apologise and leave.
